reviewText:
The Families of the World videos are excellent educational tools. In each video, which is thirty minutes long, we follow a day in the life of two children, one from an urban area and one from a rural area. A narrator explains, in English, what the child is doing and explains any cultural points of interest. These videos are great for giving children a brief glimpse into life in another country.

The main drawback to these videos is the cost - most educational videos are a little over-priced. Also, don't expect high production values or anything, and there's nothing flashy, so if your children are being raised by TV, they might find the video not stimulating enough.

Our class did a cultural study on Japan. My students - 1st, 2nd and 3rd graders enjoyed it.  As a teacher what I liked is that it showed what life was like for a Japanese kid from their point of view. There is a movie out there has 2 white kids visiting Japan - lame. It shows what life is like in the city and what life is like on a farm. I like the comparison. I do think it is a bit pricy for just a half an hour show. I would have liked to see a bit more since finding quality cultural videos is so difficult.  Otherwise helpful and informative and totally kid friendly.

This product was sent promptly and is used in the classroom during studies of Japan.
Retailer was very prompt with delivery.
